action.action-desc: Mr. Royce (for himself, Mr. Engel, Mr. Chabot, Ms. Bordallo, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Kennedy, and Mr. Messer) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: Affirming the importance of the Taiwan Relations Act.

whereas.text: Whereas when the Taiwan Relations Act was enacted, it affirmed that the United States decision to establish diplomatic relations with the People’s Republic of China was based on the expectation that the future of Taiwan would be determined by peaceful means;

Whereas the Taiwan Relations Act states that it is the policy of the United States to provide Taiwan with arms of a defensive character to maintain the capacity to resist any resort to force or other forms of coercion that would jeopardize the security, or the social or economic system, of the people on Taiwan;
Whereas the relationship between the United States and Taiwan has been strengthened with—

paragraph.text: Taiwan’s evolution into a free society and a full-fledged, multi-party democracy;
the development of Taiwan’s robust market economy;
Taiwan’s determined effort and collaboration with the United States to combat global terrorism, as demonstrated in part by its participation in the Container Security Initiative; and

the leadership role Taiwan has demonstrated in addressing transnational and global challenges, including its active engagement in humanitarian relief measures, public health endeavors, environmental protection initiatives, and financial market stabilization efforts;

whereas.text: Whereas the United States and Taiwan are united in our shared values in fair elections, personal liberty, and free enterprise: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: reaffirms its unwavering commitment to the Taiwan Relations Act as the cornerstone of relations between the United States and Taiwan;
reaffirms its support for Taiwan’s democratic institutions;
reaffirms that peace in the Taiwan Strait should be maintained to the benefit of the 23,000,000 free people of Taiwan;
supports the United States commitment to Taiwan’s security in accord with the Taiwan Relations Act, including the sale of sophisticated defensive weapons to Taiwan;
supports the strong and deepening relationship between the United States and Taiwan.
